org.sakaiproject.portal.util

Class ToolURLManagerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sakaiproject.portal.util.ToolURLManagerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ToolURLManager

    public class ToolURLManagerImpl
extends Object
implements ToolURLManager
    This is a default implementation of the ToolURLManager and it comes with a default implementation of ToolURL for all three URL types (render, action and resource). This implementation can be used by most portals that don't do any special URL encoding.
    Author:
    Vishal Goenka

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ToolURLManagerImpl.MyToolURL
      This is a simple implemention of ToolURL that does the most obvious encoding of URLs.

      Constructor for ToolURLComponent

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ToolURL createActionURL()
      Create a URL that is an action performed on this tool.
      ToolURL createRenderURL()
      Create a URL that is a hyperlink back to this tool.
      ToolURL createResourceURL()
      Create a URL for a resource related to the tool, but not necessarily pointing back to the tool.

        public ToolURLManagerImpl(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
        Constructor for ToolURLComponent
        Parameters:
        req - HttpServletRequest that the URLs will be generated for
        resp - HttpServletResponse that the URL will be encoded for

    • Method Detail

      • createRenderURL

        public ToolURL createRenderURL()
        Description copied from interface: ToolURLManager
        Create a URL that is a hyperlink back to this tool. HTTP GET requests initiated by simple <a href> construct falls in this category.
        Specified by:
        createRenderURL in interface ToolURLManager
        Returns:
        a URL that is a hyperlink back to this tool

      • createActionURL

        public ToolURL createActionURL()
        Description copied from interface: ToolURLManager
        Create a URL that is an action performed on this tool. HTML Form actions that initiate an HTTP POST back to the tool falls in this category.
        Specified by:
        createActionURL in interface ToolURLManager
        Returns:
        a URL that is an action performed on this tool

      • createResourceURL

        public ToolURL createResourceURL()
        Description copied from interface: ToolURLManager
        Create a URL for a resource related to the tool, but not necessarily pointing back to the tool. Image files, CSS files, JS files etc. are examples of Resource URLs. Paths for resource URLs may have to be relative to the server, as opposed to being relative to the tool.
        Specified by:
        createResourceURL in interface ToolURLManager
        Returns:
        a URL for a resource
